Notes.Text:
This update for GraphicsMagick fixes the following issues: 

- CVE-2016-5118: popen() shell vulnerability via special filenames (bnc#982178).
- CVE-2013-4589: The ExportAlphaQuantumType function in export.c in GraphicsMagick might have allowed remote attackers to cause a denial of service (crash) via vectors related to exporting the alpha of an 8-bit RGBA image (bsc#851064).
- CVE-2015-8808: Out-of-bound read in the parsing of GIF files (bnc#965574).
Notes.Title: Details

Vulnerabilities.Description: The DecodeImage function in coders/gif.c in GraphicsMagick 1.3.18 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (uninitialized memory access) via a crafted GIF file.

Vulnerabilities.Description: The OpenBlob function in blob.c in GraphicsMagick before 1.3.24 and ImageMagick allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code via a | (pipe) character at the start of a filename.
